cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 525 miles SE of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across the Gulf of Mexico, forecast to turn northwest toward the upper Texas / southwest Louisiana coast, then curve north-northwest and finally northeast across the lower Mississippi Valley toward the Ohio/Tennessee valleys and Mid-Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX-LA border (Lake Charles–Cameron area, southwest Louisiana)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and Storm-Surge Watches extend along the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coasts (San Luis Pass TX to west of Morgan City LA).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and Storm-Surge Warnings from San Luis Pass TX to the Mouth of the Mississippi River, including the TX-LA border region.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast, southwest and south-central Louisiana coast, then inland across the lower Mississippi Valley.
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (no Ohio locations listed in the wind-probability table)
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty winds (20–30 mph) possible as remnant low passes south/east of Lake Erie late Saturday, but tropical-storm-force winds are not expected.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – port is inland on Lake Erie and outside storm-surge zone.
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could bring 1–2 inches of rain to northern Ohio late 28–29 Aug; widespread flash flooding not expected at Toledo.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Reduced visibility and standing water on terminal surfaces could briefly disrupt cargo/rail movements; otherwise minimal direct cyclone effects expected.
